critique: The document concerns a change to the civil service rules within the Department of the Interior, specifically regarding the hiring of assistant attorneys and law clerks. It mandates that these positions, previously exempt, will now be subject to competitive examination. This suggests a move towards a more meritocratic and standardized hiring process. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power dynamics, federalism implications, national security concerns, economic regulation, or social inclusion/exclusion. The change seems primarily focused on internal administrative procedure.
